meanings.definition: The right to receive the full value of a life insurance policy if it is surrendered before maturity.
meanings.sent1: She was relieved to have nonforfeitures on her life insurance policy.
meanings.sent2: The nonforfeitures in the policy protected her investment.
meanings.sent3: The nonforfeitures in the policy felt like a safety net for her family's future.
meanings.sent4: The nonforfeitures were like a shield, guarding her financial security.
meanings.sent5: The nonforfeitures were her lifeline in times of need.

meanings.definition: A provision in an insurance policy that guarantees the policyholder will not lose the cash value of the policy if it is surrendered.
meanings.sent1: He appreciated the nonforfeitures clause in his insurance policy.
meanings.sent2: The nonforfeitures ensured he wouldn't lose his policy's value.
meanings.sent3: The nonforfeitures clause was like a promise of financial protection.
meanings.sent4: The nonforfeitures provision was a safety cushion for unexpected situations.
meanings.sent5: The nonforfeitures clause was his security blanket in uncertain times.
